entry.title: Interpersonal conflicts
entry.summary:
...don't exist.

...have no form.


They are just absence.

An absence of communication.


A misaligned expectation.


Both parties mean good.

Both partes do their best.


Just point to this vacuum.

Directly, without fear, together.


And let compassion fill the empty space.

entry.title: Read like a stoic
entry.summary:
What if you will never hold that book again?

What if this is the last time that book is available to you?


A bit sad, isn't it?

But at the same time, do you feel the energy and dedication to fully digest the book?


Squeeze every last drop of information your mind calls for.

Don't let knowledge pass through.

Make it stick: take notes, talk, visualize, write, reread.

Make the book part of your personality.

Make it a unique moment.


Like a place you might never see again...

entry.title: Dissatisfying status quo
entry.summary:
Not satisfied with status quo and lacking strength to decide the next step?

A long-term relationship you haven't been satisfied with.

A side project you hibernated but has been lurking in your head for months.

An apartment you constantly complain about but have been living in for years.

Put an either-or decision crossroad in front of you with two resolute paths changing the current situation.

Either break up with her/him
or get engaged this year.

Either get at least one paying customer in the next 3 months
or delete all the source code.

Either renovate the place and make it comfortable
or find a new place to live.

Such crossroad will help you discover the direction.

And fill you with courage and determination to walk the chosen path.

entry.title: Drop constrains of planning
entry.summary:
Plans.

Not goals or ambitions. Our daily plans and expectations.

List of city attractions to see on Saturday.

Required arrival time, because our favorite restaurant closes.

Agenda for a date we push ourselves to follow.


As if we know what our bodies and minds will feel like in future.

Closing ourselves to the opportunities the world offers.

Obliged to follow the predefined plan.


Loose the constraints.

Open yourself to new opportunities.

Hop on the wave of the present.

Like a surfer.

Let your mind and your body dictate the moment.

Embrace the unexpected.

And enjoy the wave.

entry.title: Burden of your belongings
entry.summary:
Clothes, furniture, sport equipment, gifts. Select them wisely.

Every item carries a burden. Storing. Cleaning. Transporting when moving houses.

Feeling bad when not using it. Feeling even worse when getting rid of it.

Cluttering the space of your home.

Draining the wallet.

Temporarily satisfying the thirst for novelty.


Resist.

Think twice. Rent before buying. Prefer non-material gifts. Limit the burden.

Create space.

And enjoy the power.

entry.title: Best days
entry.summary:
“Enjoy life to its fullest.”

What does it mean?

To me, devoting full attention to the activity at hand.

When you work, you work.

When you relax, you relax.

When you are with your loved one, you are with your loved one.

No distractions.

Present. In the moment.

Those days are the best.

entry.title: Reduce work time
entry.summary:
Best days are not easy to come by.

A major obstacle is the 40-hour work week.

Sharp focus and peak performance for eight hours a day.

Every day. Every week. Every months. Every year.

Distractions appear. Focus is gone. Productivity slows down.

Eight hours is too much.

We need to allow ourselves less time so we can deliver more.

Reduce your work hours. Or go fully in for a few weeks but compensate with a period of rest.

entry.title: Choose distractions carefully
entry.summary:
With a FitBit tracker, you might not follow your desire and go for a walk instead.

With Instagram, you might miss the moment while trying to impress others with the perfect picture.

With a watch, you allow yourself to be constantly aware of the time.

With mobile notifications, you might ruin the beautiful moment of silence with your best friend.

Just be aware of the cost when adding a new distraction to your day.
